data.question: What is the full name of the compound abbreviated as TTTA?
What is the role of TTTA in the coordination complex with Cu(hfac)2?
data.answer: TTTA acts as a ligand to form polymeric coordination complexes.

data.question: How was the 1:1 complex TTTA·Cu(hfac)2 obtained?
data.answer: By the reaction of stoichiometric amounts of the components in hot heptane solution under nitrogen atmosphere.

data.question: What is the space group of the crystal structure of TTTA·Cu(hfac)2?
What type of magnetic interaction is suggested between Cu(II)−TTTA A and Cu(II)−TTTA B?
data.answer: Ferromagnetic coupling with TTTA A and antiferromagnetic interaction with TTTA B.

data.question: What does the abrupt decrease in χpT value below 30 K indicate?
data.answer: A weak antiferromagnetic coupling between the ferromagnetic units.

data.question: What is the significance of the orthogonal relation between the SOMO of TTTA A and the magnetic d x2-y2 orbital on the Cu(hfac)2 molecular plane?
data.answer: It suggests a ferromagnetic coupling between TTTA A and Cu(hfac)2.

data.question: Why does TTTA·Cu(hfac)2 show a gradual increase in χpT value from 300 to 30 K?
data.answer: Because of the ferromagnetic coupling indicating by the coordination bond between Cu(hfac)2 and TTTA A.

data.question: What does the presence of a large thermal hysteresis loop in TTTA indicate?
data.answer: A unique first-order phase transition between a paramagnetic high-temperature phase and a diamagnetic low-temperature phase.

data.question: How does the chemical capability of polycyclic thiazyl radicals like TTTA compare to nitronylnitroxides?
data.answer: Polycyclic thiazyl radicals possess similar chemical capability to act as ligands in coordination polymers.

data.question: What does the short distance between S(1) on TTTA B and O(4) in the hfac ligand suggest?
data.answer: An overlap between the magnetic orbitals of TTTA B and Cu(hfac)2, resulting in an antiferromagnetic interaction.

data.question: Is TTTA·Cu(hfac)2 the first coordination polymer made of thiazyl radicals?
Does TTTA·Cu(hfac)2 crystallize in the cubic space group?
Is the magnetic interaction between Cu(II)−TTTA A stronger than that between Cu(II)−TTTA B?
Was Cu(hfac)2 synthesized specifically for this study?
Does the magnetic data of TTTA·Cu(hfac)2 support a purely antiferromagnetic interaction model?
Is the ferromagnetic coupling in TTTA·Cu(hfac)2 weaker than the antiferromagnetic coupling?
Can TTTA act as a bidentate bridging ligand?
